body.p: Estimate the mass of glucose C6H12O6 using the information in the table showing the mass of the elements. Access the table by clicking the "This table" link above.

Correct. Carbon has a mass of 12. In glucose there are 6 Carbon atoms. 12 x 6= 72. Hydrogen has a mass of 1. In glucose there are 12 Hydrogen atoms. 1 x 12= 12. Oxygen has a mass of 16. In glucose there are 6 Oxygen atoms. 16 x 6= 96. 72 + 12 + 96 = 180

hint.p: Find the mass of each atom in the molecule. The multiply the mass of each atom with the number of atoms in the molecule. The last step is to add the resulting numbers to get the total mass of the molecule.
